Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Mature Animal or Sphinx and Lion Style pottery cup, possibly a kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with chain of circles in added white and added red; below, band of dots between white lines; exterior: black-figure undetermined motif; part of incised rosette as filling ornament; below above handle zone, two brown lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The number 33 written in pencil on exterior. The cup shape is not a typical form in the Sphinx and Lion Style. Contemporary with the Sphinx and Lion Style is the Mature Animal Style in which cups are the most typical form. Incision is not found on vases of the Mature Animal Style but the the interior decoration and exterior filling ornament on this sherd are very typical of that style. This cup, one of only a few, appears to be influenced by both styles. For another example, see British Museum 1924, 1201.208 and 1965,0930.305.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1649) (phase 2)
